content.description: Follows a crack up a series of short triangular roofs
content.protection: Bolts. It is easy to lead this route using gear as protection in the crack. Route can easily be toproped.
content.location: Route is located on the far left of the Dam climbing area at the base of a set of twin cracks.  Shares a start with Shakey Dog, Triangles follows the left hand crack.

content.description: Follows a crack up to a small roof then out right onto a left facing sloppy flake.
content.location: Shares a start with Triangle on the far left end of the Dam climbing area.  Follows the right of the two cracks.

content.description: Start in the crack and follow it up the face.  Main crack tapers out near the top, traverse left to another finger crack and top out.
content.protection: Small to medium stoppers and cams from fingers to hands (.5 to 2).  Use trees at the top of the cliff for anchors.
content.location: Located on the face to the left of Hot Monkey Love.  Look for the S shaped crack in the middle of the face between Gargamel and Doing Time.

content.description: Climb the cracks up the dihedral.
content.protection: Medium to larger gear, best to top rope this route.  Anchor from trees at the top of the cliff.
content.location: Located in the dihedral to the left of Hot Monkey Love.

content.description: Vertical face climbing up small edges and pockets.
content.location: Located 10 feet to the right of Shakey Dog

content.description: This climb is slightly overhung and will dish out sloppers, monos, painful underclings and the like. Use the chicken head cautiously and enjoy the finishing crux. easy toprope access
content.protection: 4 bolts and cold shuts for anchors
content.location: In the Dam area, found on the wall to the right of the S crack.

content.description: Balancy bouldery start that leads to easy slab climbing.
content.location: Located on the right side of the prominent arete to the right of Mono e Mono

content.description: A slightly overhanging start on big holds to a stance, followed by a slightly thinner move to more jugs and a dirt top out. Extremely dirty, like most Vesuvius climbs, but the holds are there and the moves are fun Red River-type hauls. Enjoyable, if brief.
content.protection: The FA was done as a rope solo using the big tree 5 ft to the left of the arete for an anchor. Could be led with some small gear (around Camalot .4) in horizontals at about 15 and 20 ft, if one were so inclined.
content.location: Hike down the main trail from the dam about 100 yards until the trail crosses a dinner table sized flat rock, then turn right. There are 3 house-sized detached boulders here; walk straight up to the main wall, keeping the boulders on your right. The climb is on the obvious pocketed arete.

content.description: Bouldery start up to roof, pull through the roof and continue up the easier slabby face.
content.location: Located on the face to the left of Hot Monkey Love between S Crack an Oh So Slippery.  Starts under the prominent roof.

content.description: This area is the ridge that makes the southern boundary of the lake. The faces are all parallel to the dam. They are shaded and can be wet for many hours after a hard rain. There are 7 established routes ranging from 5.5 to 5.11a bolted with two bolt anchors. Sandstone.Â
